link.synopsis: No one would accuse director Anthony Thomas of presenting an unbiased view of religious fundamentalism in this film, which won a Special Grand Jury Prize at the Sundance Film Festival. Intent on exposing what he perceives to be a dangerous connection between the religious and political right, Thomas interviews born-again Christians and then directs his lens on Heritage USA, the religious complex established by Jim and Tammy Faye Bakker.
link.title: synopsis
Eyes on the Prize: America's Civil Rights Years 1954-1965
The Emperor's Naked Army Marches On
National Geographic: Search for the Battleship Bismarck
Texas Chainsaw Massacre: A Family Portrait
The Making of Fanny and Alexander
William S. Burroughs: Commissioner of Sewers
The Spencer Tracy Legacy: A Tribute by Katharine Hepburn
Martin Luther King, Jr: I Have a Dream
Private Practices: The Story of a Sex Surrogate
Falasha: Exile of the Black Jews

title.regular: Thy Kingdom Come ... Thy Will Be Done
title.short: Thy Kingdom Come ... Thy Will Be Done

link.synopsis: Armed with guts, determination and passion, three women set out to crash the sold-out Source Awards, an annual event honoring the hottest rappers in the business. It doesn't matter that the ladies don't have backstage passes … they'll find a way in. Highlights include music by Jagged Edge and Lil' Bow Wow, along with footage from the infamous melee at the 2000 awards that sent DJ Quik to the hospital.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family
Bow Wow: Dog Tag & Papers Included
Wyclef Jean's All-Star Jam at Carnegie Hall
Slip N Slide: All Star Weekend
Mr. Capone: A Day "N" the Life of Mr. Capone
Chuck D's Hip Hop Hall of Fame
WC: Bandana Swangin: All That Glitters Ain't Gold
The Cross Movement: Holy Culture Live
Really Really Pimpin' in Da South
Bone Thugs N Harmony: Greatest Video Hits
South Beach Sounds: Miami Music Week: Vol. 1
Loudes 68: The Movement of Hip-Hop and Reggaeton
Mister D: From Southland to Japan
Three 6 Mafia: The Ultimate Video Collection
Wu-Tang Clan: Legend of the Wu-Tang: The Videos
The Coup: The Best Coup DVD Ever
Public Enemy: It Takes a Nation: London Invasion 1987
Hustle Up DVD Magazine: Vol. 2: Hip-Hop
All Access DVD Magazine: The Remix: Vol. 1

title.regular: On the Come Up at the Source Awards
title.short: On the Come Up at the Source Awards

link.synopsis: Survival is the name of the game in this made-for-TV twin bill. When her abusive father (Gerald McRaney) insists that his wife ran off, the prescient dreams of suspicious Sarah Zarn (Katy Boyer) provide a clue to her mother's mysterious disappearance in A Nightmare Come True. Based on real events, Two Came Back stars Melissa Joan Hart and Jonathan Brandis as a young couple stranded at sea after a mammoth storm scuttles their vessel.
link.title: synopsis
Take Me Home: The John Denver Story
In the Lake of the Woods
Search and Rescue / River of Rage
In the Line of Duty: The FBI Murders
The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring: Extended Edition
The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
Tae Guk Gi: The Brotherhood of War

title.regular: A Nightmare Come True / Two Came Back
title.short: A Nightmare Come True / Two Came Back

link.synopsis: Set in Costa Rica, this film tells the story of a young, brokenhearted woman's backpacking trip that takes a rather unique turn when she comes to the conclusion that her companion -- her best friend -- might have different plans for the journey. Kris Swanberg ("Young American Bodies," Kissing on the Mouth) writes and directs this coming-of-age drama in which Jade Healy (Death in Love, The Blue Hour ) co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2
Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys
What Kind of Love Is This?
Snow Flower and the Secret Fan

title.regular: It Was Great, But I Was Ready to Come Home
title.short: It Was Great, But I Was Ready to Come Home

link.synopsis: Murder's on the menu in this double presentation of suspense films from the 1970s that feature Eileen Brennan and Meredith Baxter in pivotal roles: The Invasion of Carol Enders (1973) and Come Die With Me (1974). First, Baxter stars as a mugging victim who falls into a coma and becomes someone else entirely. Then, Brennan plays a long-suffering housekeeper who blackmails her murderous employer into an affair.
link.title: synopsis
The Black Belly of the Tarantula
Perry Mason: The Case of the Defiant Daughter
Sherlock Holmes: The Woman in Green
Hopalong Cassidy: Riders of the Timberline / Riders of the Deadline / False Paradise / Unexpected Guest / Wide Open Town
The Bird with the Crystal Plumage

title.regular: The Invasion of Carol Enders / Come Die With Me
title.short: Invasion of Carol Enders/Come Die With Me

link.synopsis: Sidney Poitier made his directorial debut with this 1972 action-comedy about odd couple Buck (Poitier) and an ex-con preacher (Harry Belafonte) who battle bounty hunters while leading a group of former slaves to Western settlements. Poitier and Belafonte click, Ruby Dee and Cameron Mitchell co-star, and jazz great Benny Carter charted the film's distinctive score.
link.title: synopsis
Five on the Black Hand Side
The Life and Times of Judge Roy Bean
The Return of a Man Called Horse
The Bingo Long Traveling All-Stars and Motor Kings

link.synopsis: Fright master Wes Craven and superstar funnyman Eddie Murphy meet in the middle for this horror-comedy featuring Murphy as Maximillian, the lone survivor of a race of vampires who comes to Brooklyn in search of a way to live past the next full moon. His ticket to survival is Rita (Angela Bassett), a NYPD detective who doesn't know she's half vampire -- and Maximillian will do whatever's necessary to put her under his spell.
link.title: synopsis
The Lair of the White Worm

link.synopsis: Comediennes and "Absolutely Fabulous" creators Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders star in this compilation of the best skits and spoofs from the fourth season of their BBC comedy-sketch series. They take aim at British culture, BBC television, pop stars and the Middle Ages, but most of the material focuses on Hollywood. The duo hilariously skewers such movies as Silence of the Lambs, Alien, Misery and Thelma & Louise.
link.title: synopsis
French & Saunders: Gentlemen Prefer French & Saunders
French & Saunders: Back with a Vengeance
The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
The Vicar of Dibley: A Holy Wholly Happy Ending
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
A Bit of Fry and Laurie
The Best of Not the 9 O'Clock News
French & Saunders: Living in a Material World
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
The Best of So Graham Norton
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Gilda Radner
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Eric Idle's Personal Best
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Phil Hartman
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Hercules Against the Moon Men

link.synopsis: This anthology of 10 vintage short comedies starring juvenile jesters Jackie, Stymie, Spanky, Buckwheat, Alfalfa and the rest of the gang will spark happy memories for nostalgic movie buffs. Included are When the Wind Blows (1930), Shiver My Timbers (1931), Free Wheeling (1932), Choo-Choo! (1932), Mike Fright (1934), Washee Ironee (1934), Divot Diggers (1936), Bored of Education (1936), Fishy Tales (1937) and Framing Youth (1937).
link.title: synopsis
The Little Rascals: The Complete Series
Cartoons That Time Forgot: Van Beuren Studios
Cartoons That Time Forgot: UB Iwerks Collection: Vol. 1
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore
Warner Bros. Home Entertainment Presents: Academy Awards' Animation Collection: 15 Winners
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 6

title.regular: The Little Rascals: Collector's Edition III

link.synopsis: Claudette Colbert turns on the charm in this duo of breezy romantic comedies set in France: I Met Him in Paris (1937) and the Billy Wilder and Charles Brackett-scripted farce Bluebeard's Eighth Wife (1938). The first finds fashion designer Colbert visiting the City of Lights, where she's pursued by two would-be suitors (Melvyn Douglas and Robert Young). In the second, Colbert falls for a millionaire who's been married seven times (Gary Cooper).
link.title: synopsis
Beat the Devil / That Uncertain Feeling
If You Could Only Cook / Too Many Husbands
No Time for Love / The Egg and I
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
I Was a Male War Bride

title.regular: I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
title.short: I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's 8th Wife

link.synopsis: Detective Lilly Rush (Kathryn Morris), the sole woman in Philadelphia's homicide squad, finds her passion when she's assigned to cold cases that have stymied other investigators. As she finds long-hidden clues, Rush procures overdue justice for forgotten victims. Rush assembles an elite team to assist her, including Kat Miller (Tracie Thoms), and together they tackle a vast array of baffling cases, sometimes reopening decades-old wounds.
link.title: synopsis
Cagney & Lacey: The View Through the Glass Ceiling
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: Playing for Ashes
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: In the Presence of the Enemy
Cold Case Files: The Most Infamous Cases
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: The Word of God
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: The Seed of Cunning
Masterpiece Mystery!: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries: In the Guise of Death
Homicide: Life on the Street: Season 4

link.synopsis: This fascinating documentary chronicles the intense 18-hour recording session of celebrated composer Stephen Sondheim's landmark musical "Company," which features the original 1970 Broadway cast members. From the first chords of the overture to leading lady Elaine Stritch's attempt to hit the right note in "The Ladies Who Lunch," the film provides an intimate behind-the-scenes look at the exhausting creative endeavor.
link.title: synopsis
Sondheim: A Celebration at Carnegie Hall
My Favorite Broadway: The Leading Ladies
Sing Faster: The Stagehands' Ring Cycle
Broadway & Hollywood Legends: The Songwriters: Kander & Ebb / Alan Jay Lerner
Sunday in the Park with George
Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
Broadway's Lost Treasures III: The Best of the Tony Awards
Recording the Producers: A Musical Romp with Mel Brooks
Live a Little, Love a Little
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars: The Motion Picture

link.synopsis: Malik (Ajay Devgan) is the right-hand man of a criminal boss. When the gang's activities begin to expand, Malik recruits Chandu (Vivek Oberoi), and together they try to overthrow the big boss. Soon, Malik and Chandu move their base of operations to Hong Kong. Can they throw investigating cops off their scent? Soon, a misunderstanding causes a schism between the two friends -- and someone has to take the fall.
link.title: synopsis
Raja Ko Rani Se Pyar Ho Gaya
Love Ke Liye Kuch Bhi Karega
Once Upon a Time in Mumbai

link.synopsis: In this drama from Robert Altman, a young dancer (Neve Campbell) is focused on becoming a principal dancer with her ballet company, but finds it progressively more difficult to stick to the demanding schedule that's required. As the pressure mounts, she grows more preoccupied with other interests and with her boyfriend (James Franco), who vies for her time. The story is based on Campbell's own experiences at the National Ballet School of Canada.
link.title: synopsis
Jerome Robbins: Something to Dance About
Dancing for Mr. B: Six Balanchine Ballerinas
Etoiles: Dancers of the Paris Opera Ballet
American Ballet Theatre in Swan Lake
It's Kind of a Funny Story
The City of Your Final Destination

link.synopsis: When Laurel (Whoopi Goldberg) learns that her less-smart and sexist protégé, Frank (Tim Daly), is promoted, she quits to start her own company -- only to find out that the male-dominated Wall Street world can't take an African American woman seriously. And  when her older, white, male business partner becomes the financial district's favored whiz, things really take a turn for the worse. Dianne Wiest co-stars in this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Whoopi: Back on Broadway: The 20th Anniversary
Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
Empire Records: Remix! Special Fan Edition

link.synopsis: Groucho, Chico and Harpo -- the famed trio of siblings known collectively as the Marx Brothers -- star in their first big-screen comedy, backed by a score penned by the legendary Irving Berlin. Hilarity ensues as a hotel owner (Groucho Marx) launches a string of get-rich-quick schemes to bail out his bankrupt resort. And although he's aided by a pair of goofballs (Chico and Harpo), they mostly succeed in fouling things up.
link.title: synopsis
Marx Brothers: Marx Brothers Mixed Nuts
Marx Brothers: Inside the Marx Brothers
Marx Brothers: "You Bet Your Life" Pilot
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: The Bank Dick
W.C. Fields Comedy Collection: My Little Chickadee
The Three Stooges: Healthy, Wealthy and Dumb
Never Give a Sucker an Even Break

link.synopsis: Renowned director Ivan Reitman helms an all-star cast for this mysterious romantic comedy. District Attorney Tom Logan (Robert Redford) is prosecuting Chelsea Deardon (Daryl Hannah) for art theft when Chelsea's attorney, Laura Kelly (Debra Winger), asks for his help. The twists begin when Chelsea is accused of murder the same night she seduces Tom. After losing his job, Tom helps Laura in defending Chelsea, and a new romance blossoms.
link.title: synopsis
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie
The Gun in Betty Lou's Handbag
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun

link.synopsis: Famous comedian Petey Wheatstraw (Rudy Ray Moore) is shot dead by envious rivals and makes a deal with the devil (G. Tito Shaw) in this blaxploitation comedy. Petey agrees to marry Lucifer's ugly daughter (Skillet Ebony Wright) and is sent back to Earth to fulfill his promise. Lucifer also gives Petey magic powers to help him get rid of the men who had him killed. But things heat up when Petey tries to back out of his deal with the devil.
link.title: synopsis
Rudy Ray Moore: Live at Wetlands: N.Y.C.
Can I Do It ... Til I Need Glasses?

link.synopsis: In David Mamet's acclaimed comedy, Jerry (Joe Mantegna), a misfit Mafia henchman, is assigned the low-level job of keeping an eye on Gino (Don Ameche), a shoe repairman fingered by the Mob to confess to a murder he didn't commit. But Gino's mistaken for a Mafia boss, and the two are suddenly catapulted to the highest levels of mobster status. Only friendship will see them through this dangerous adventure alive!
link.title: synopsis
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie

link.synopsis: Joanne Woodward and Paul Newman star in this lighthearted romantic farce about plain Jane fashion buyer Samantha Blake, who gets a dramatic makeover and is subsequently mistaken for a glamorous call girl by womanizing reporter Steve Sherman. Paris, the City of Light, serves as the backdrop for this whimsical Oscar-nominated comedy that co-stars Eva Gabor and Maurice Chevalier.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
Woman in Love / Ice from Space
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: When a group of small-town firemen find out that their chief is retiring, they organize a party to end all parties. But as soon as the celebration commences, the attendees experience one disaster after another. There are stolen raffle prizes, unwilling beauty contestants and even a fire. This Czechoslovakian comedy -- the last film director Milos Forman made in his native country -- received an Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film.
link.title: synopsis
Valerie and Her Week of Wonders
Good Soldier Schweik 2: Beg to Report, Sir
I Served the King of England
I Love You, Alice B. Toklas!
The End of August at the Hotel Ozone
The Knack...and How to Get It
Dr. Goldfoot and the Bikini Machine
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
Jan Svankmajer: The Ossuary and Other Tales
The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming
Love Affair, or The Case of the Missing Switchboard Operator

link.synopsis: Divorced ex-con Johnny (Al Pacino) becomes a cook at a Manhattan café, where he falls in love with Frankie (Michelle Pfeiffer), a beautiful waitress with a painful past. Despite the fact that she wants nothing to do with him, Johnny does everything he can to win Frankie's heart. Based on a play by Terrence McNally, director Garry Marshall's touching romantic comedy co-stars Hector Elizondo, Kate Nelligan and Nathan Lane.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: Strapped for cash, three fraternity playboys (Barry Watson, Harland Williams and Michael Rosenbaum) make one last attempt to live the high life -- cheaply -- by masquerading as girls! In this hilarious gender-bending comedy, our "heroes" pick up their heels, put on some makeup and move into the Delta Omicron Gamma (or D.O.G.) sorority house. But their chauvinistic ways come back to haunt them as they get a crash course in the opposite sex!
link.title: synopsis
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
Revenge of the Nerds III: The Next Generation
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son

link.synopsis: Prison escapee Trevor Finch (Christian Slater) assumes the identity of a deceased man, Cletis Tout, but soon discovers that someone had put out a hit on Cletis. Now, Finch and fellow escapee Micah (Richard Dreyfuss) must outrun both the police and hit man Critical Jim (Tim Allen). All the while, they're pursuing Micah's loot of hidden diamonds. Portia de Rossi co-stars as Finch's girlfriend, Tess, in this caper comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
You Don't Mess with the Zohan

link.synopsis: When the owner of the flailing Minnesota Twins dies, the team is handed to his grandson Billy (Luke Edwards), a 12-year-old with a love of baseball and an uncanny sense of the team's needs. But the jaded players want to bolt when Billy becomes manager, and things get worse when his friends grow mad because he's turned baseball into business. Can Billy fix it all -- and still be a kid? Andrew Scheinman and Bill Pohlad direct this family comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Life and Times of Hank Greenberg
Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events

link.synopsis: In this hilarious comedy directed by Christopher Cain, Danny Glover and Joe Pesci play Gus and Joe, two buddies from New Jersey who love to fish -- and wind up with a rather unusual catch during an excursion to the Everglades. Having won a fishing trip after acing the local Bait & Tackle's essay contest (the subject: "How Come We Fish"), the pair head for the great outdoors. But instead of reeling in a big bass, they help nab a big-shot criminal!
link.title: synopsis
Bass Fishing: The Basics with Chuck Woolery
100 Saltwater Fishing Mistakes & How to Avoid Them
The Shakiest Gun in the West / The Love God?: Double Feature
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
Cowboy Heroes of the Silver Screen
Erasure: Live at Royal Albert Hall
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold
Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas

link.synopsis: Jack (Richard E. Grant), a recently widowed father, learns that his yuppie lifestyle and workaholic ways don't mesh well with a new baby's needs. Overwhelmed by his parental responsibilities, he hires Amy (Samantha Mathis), an American waitress, to be his baby's nanny. Although she's completely inexperienced, Amy soon turns out to be the only voice of reason in Jack's chaotic world. A charming British comedy that also stars Judi Dench.
link.title: synopsis
The Last of the Blonde Bombshells
Three Men and a Little Lady

link.synopsis: When the entire royal family is electrocuted in a freak accident, it leaves Las Vegas lounge singer Ralph Jones (John Goodman) the lone heir to the English throne. Aided by a family servant (Peter O'Toole), boorish slob Ralph does his best to rise to the occasion. John Hurt plays his scheming adversary, Percival Graves, a British lord who plots the new monarch's downfall in this genial comedy from director David S. Ward.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Miranda is a sensual tavern owner with a taste for men of all types. Over a year's time, Miranda copes with the death of her husband by enjoying the talents of a different lover for each of the four seasons. All the men are delightful, but which one is the best lover, and who will make a suitable husband? This lewd comedy from director Tinto Brass stars Serena Grandi -- who was once voted "The Sexiest Woman in Italy" -- in the title role.
link.title: synopsis
Emanuelle and the White Slave Trade
Kama Sutra: A Tale of Love

link.synopsis: No topic is off limits to the side-splitting sketch comedy partnership of Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders, creators of the groundbreaking British sitcom "Absolutely Fabulous." In this collection of sketches from Series 1 and 2, the dynamic duo takes on James Bond, the Pet Shop Boys, dance trends, Liza Minnelli, Hollywood musicals and more. Guests include Jools Holland, Robbie Coltrane and Rik Mayall.
link.title: synopsis
French & Saunders: Living in a Material World
French & Saunders: Gentlemen Prefer French & Saunders
French & Saunders: Back with a Vengeance
The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
The Vicar of Dibley: A Holy Wholly Happy Ending
A Bit of Fry and Laurie
The Best of Not the 9 O'Clock News
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Gilda Radner
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Eric Idle's Personal Best
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Robot vs. The Aztec Mummy
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Crawling Hand
The Dame Edna Experience: The Christmas Specials
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Santa Claus Conquers the Martians

link.synopsis: Comedienne Sarah Silverman's smashing and eclectic one-woman show, Jesus Is Magic, is translated for the big screen in this offbeat film -- part concert and part monologue, with a dash of MTV thrown into the mix. Silverman, of course, is in fine form, working blue from the first minute, eager to jump into shark-infested comedy waters and fearless beyond belief about everything from dead grandmothers to religion.
link.title: synopsis
I'm the One That I Want
Lisa Lampanelli: Take It Like a Man
Lisa Lampanelli: Long Live the Queen
Lisa Lampanelli: Dirty Girl: No Protection
Kathy Griffin: She'll Cut a Bitch
Zach Galifianakis: Live at the Purple Onion
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show
Carlos Mencia: The Best of "Funny Is Funny"
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Precaucion: Richard Villa Performing This Way
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
Shaq & Cedric the Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!

link.synopsis: When loving hubby Marcello (Jean Reno) learns that his wife, Roseanna (Mercedes Ruehl), has scant weeks to live, he's determined to fulfill her last wish: to be interred beside her dead daughter. Trouble is, the local boneyard has only three vacant plots, which are first come, first served. While Roseanna plays matchmaker for the soon-to-be-widowed Marcello, he tries frantically to keep the other townsfolk safe and sound in this romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Crimson Rivers 2: Angels of the Apocalypse
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

link.synopsis: Two incompetent Western outlaws engineer several failed crimes, including a botched stagecoach holdup. Fred Williamson, a tough-guy perennial in blaxploitation movies, does a rare comedy turn as a blundering patsy to Richard Pryor's slick con man.
link.title: synopsis
Vintage Movie Classics: One Man Army
Juke Joint / Reet, Petite and Gone
The Gang that Couldn't Shoot Straight
The Longshot / They Went That-A-Way & That-A-Way
The Life and Times of Judge Roy Bean

link.synopsis: Live from New York, it's Saturday Night! On October 11, 1975, these words began a phenomenon -- a live sketch show that rocked America, set the bar for late-night comedy and launched the careers of countless stars. This anthology celebrates the first five years, featuring memorable clips from the Not Ready for Prime Time Players: Dan Aykroyd, Gilda Radner, John Belushi, Jane Curtin, Chevy Chase, Bill Murray, Garrett Morris and Laraine Newman.
link.title: synopsis
Saturday Night Live: Lost & Found: SNL in the 80's

link.synopsis: When Fox launched this plucky "Saturday Night Live" competitor based on &NFi;MAD&NFi_; magazine in 1995, the network targeted younger audiences with skits that pushed the envelope of traditional sketch comedy. Three seasons' worth of work are packed into this hilarious collection of laughs featuring Gillian Vigman, Paul Vogt, Stephnie Weir, Aries Spears, Jordan Peele, Josh Meyers, Christina Moore, Nicole Parker and Melissa Paull.

Saturday Night Live: The Best of Amy Poehler

link.synopsis: Living hand to mouth, an aspiring actress (Theresa Randle) trying to make it in New York becomes a phone-sex operator to pay the bills. Little does she know that her new anonymous identity (and myriad alter egos) will challenge her range as an actress … opening up a few doors in the process. Isaiah Washington, Jenifer Lewis, Debi Mazar and Spike Lee (who also directs) co-star in this fast, fresh comedy dotted with celebrity cameos.
link.title: synopsis
When the Levees Broke: A Requiem in Four Acts
If God Is Willing and Da Creek Don't Rise
Empire Records: Remix! Special Fan Edition
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: When East Coast teen Consuelo "Connie" Casey (Lucille Ball) announces her plans to attend the coeducational Pottawatomie College in California, her father agrees -- but not before he secretly hires four burly football players to act as her bodyguards. Desi Arnaz, Richard Carlson, Ann Miller, Eddie Bracken and Frances Langford co-star in this rollicking romantic comedy, a frothy musical also notable for being the film on which Ball and Arnaz met.
link.title: synopsis
I Love Lucy: The Movie and Other Great Rarities
Sorrowful Jones / The Paleface: Double Feature
The I Love Lucy 50th Anniversary Special
Juke Joint / Reet, Petite and Gone

link.synopsis: Emmy nominee Louise Lasser stars in Norman Lear's classic soap opera comedy about an average housewife in Ohio who deals with everyday stressors such as adultery, impotence, cults, UFOs, mass murder, exhibitionism and, of course, yellow wax buildup.
link.title: synopsis
The Tomorrow Show with Tom Snyder: John, Paul, Tom & Ringo
The Pat Paulsen Half a Comedy Hour
The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin: The Complete Series
Married... with Children: The Most Outrageous Episodes: Vol. 2
Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

link.synopsis: It's three days before the big school talent show and Kyoto, Kei and Nozumi are in a fix when their lead singer quits over artistic differences. Their only candidate to fill the spot is a Korean foreign exchange student who can barely speak Japanese. Time for some all-night rehearsals! Directed by Nobuhiro Yamashita and featuring a score by former Smashing Pumpkins member James Iha, this lighthearted comedy stars Doona Bae and Yu Kashii.
link.title: synopsis
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love
The Girl Who Leapt Through Time

link.synopsis: Written and directed by Oscar winner Anthony Hopkins, this surreal fantasy reveals the interior world of writer Felix Bonhoeffer (Hopkins). As he works on his latest mystery screenplay, the characters in his head and those in his real life begin to overlap. Part drama, part comedy and part Hollywood satire, the film boasts a superb cast, including Gena Rowlands, Christian Slater, Michael Clarke Duncan, S. Epatha Merkerson and John Turturro.
link.title: synopsis
The City of Your Final Destination
The Life & Death of Peter Sellers
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
How to Get Ahead in Advertising

link.synopsis: Beloved comedy duo Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis team up for hilarity in a pair of wacky classics directed by Norman Taurog. In The Stooge, a failed vaudeville singer (Martin) finally finds success after planting a heckler (Lewis) in his audience to spice up his act, but with fame comes a new set of problems. In Jumping Jacks, two nightclub performers become recruits for a paratrooper squad -- with riotous results.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
My Friend Irma / My Friend Irma Goes West
Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis: Vol. 2: When Television Was Funny
Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis: Vol. 3: Still Laughing
How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life / Who Was That Lady?
Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army
Martin & Lewis: Colgate Comedy Hour III & IV
The Last Time I Saw Archie
The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp
Good Soldier Schweik 2: Beg to Report, Sir
The Wackiest Ship in the Army

link.synopsis: This action comedy shows what happens when two cops with opposing ideologies -- an English-speaking officer from Toronto and a French-speaking one from Montreal -- are forced to work together to solve a crime. The duo's investigation of a demented serial killer stalking the Ontario-Quebec border coupled with their vastly different approaches to the law make for a unique brand of thriller. Erik Canuel directs.
link.title: synopsis
The Decline of the American Empire

link.synopsis: Written and directed by French auteur Jacques Tati, this nearly silent comedy stars Tati as the hapless Monsieur Hulot, a Parisian auto designer who has a tricky time delivering a prototype camper packed with crazy gadgets to a show in Amsterdam. The obstacles Hulot faces during this hilarious journey -- including a flat tire, traffic jams and an altercation with the police -- have a way of spiraling into absurdity.
link.title: synopsis
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
The Diving Bell and the Butterfly
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium

link.synopsis: Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis are at it again in this madcap comedy featuring a debt-ridden gambler (Martin) who tries to get his hapless veterinarian cousin (Lewis) to fix a horse race. But when the mob and a beautiful woman enter the mix, plans are hurled out the window and the boys must improvise, including impersonating a British jockey and wooing a woman à la Cyrano de Bergerac. Marjie Millar, Sheldon Leonard and Pat Crowley co-star.
link.title: synopsis
My Friend Irma / My Friend Irma Goes West
Don't Raise the Bridge, Lower the River
Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis: Vol. 2: When Television Was Funny
Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis: Vol. 3: Still Laughing
Martin & Lewis: At War with the Army
Martin & Lewis: Colgate Comedy Hour III & IV
It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World

link.synopsis: Russell Redds (Ice Cube) and "Jellyroll" (Mike Epps), two louche, inexperienced concert promoters from California, get their huge break when they book a famous rap star (Young Jeezy, playing himself) for a small concert hall. But the duo is unprepared for the never-ending series of complications that threatens to derail the event. Marcus Raboy (Friday After Next) directs this comedy written by Cube.
link.title: synopsis
Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded
Mike Epps Presents: Live from Club Nokia
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back

link.synopsis: Proving that they're just working stiffs like the rest of us, a slew of the funniest guys and gals around provide a heaping helping of blue-collar humor in these performances from the Montreal International Comedy Festival. Included among the featured yuksters are Larry the Cable Guy, Ron White, Frank Caliendo, Jeff Foxworthy, Bill Engvall, Jon Reep, Dom Irrera, John Caparulo, John Caponera, Kathleen Madigan, Joe Starr and more.
link.title: synopsis
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Next Generation
Larry the Cable Guy: Tailgate Party
Larry the Cable Guy: Morning Constitutions
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: One for the Road
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 3: Launching Pad
Blue Collar Comedy Tour Rides Again
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 2: On the Edge
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 1: Best of the Uptown Comics
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Live from the Laugh Factory: Vol. 1
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
The Best of Comedy Central Presents 2
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
National Lampoon Live: New Faces: Vol. 2
Comedy Central Presents: Southern Gents of Comedy
National Lampoon Live: New Faces: Vol. 1
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special

title.regular: Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Working Class Comics
title.short: Just for Laughs: Working Class Comics

link.synopsis: After declaring that he's going to film himself committing suicide for a school project, Archie (Gabriel Sunday) videotapes his surprising interactions with worried family members, interested classmates, unreliable medical experts and the hottest girl in school (Brooke Nevin). A truthful look into the hearts and minds of modern-day teenagers, this dark comedy features appearances by David Carradine, Mariel Hemingway and Harry Shearer.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this animated dark comedy, Angel is in a battle for his soul when he wakes up one morning with wings on his back and is forced to face his selfish and morally bankrupt ways. Trying to use the wings for evil, he's swayed by their divine influence. As others plot to steal his wings, Angel finds love and redemption in the most unexpected way. Filmmaker Bill Plympton features music from Tom Waits, Pink Martini and others in this surreal tale.
link.title: synopsis
Bill's Dirty Shorts: A Collection of Bill Plympton's Naughty Cartoons
Spike & Mike's Sick & Twisted Festival of Animation: Contagious
Liquid Tales: The Animated Films of Patrick Smith
Seth MacFarlane's Cavalcade of Cartoon Comedy: Uncensored
Extreme Animation: Films by Phil Mulloy
Aqua Teen Hunger Force Colon Movie Film for Theaters
National Lampoon Presents Jake's Booty Call
Spike & Mike's Classic Festival of Animation
The Best of Zagreb Film: Laugh at Your Own Risk & For Children Only

link.synopsis: John (Tim Swain) agrees to be Italian horror actress and singer Solange's (Mahogany Reynolds) assistant, and he's thrilled to be swept into her glamorous, arty European world. But when the sex and drug lifestyle gives way to murder, John begins to question Solange's motives. Based on the novel by James Derek Dwyer and filmed on location in Europe, this offbeat comedy pays homage to the cinema of the 1980s and features a hip soundtrack.
link.title: synopsis
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them 2

title.regular: The Boy with the Sun in His Eyes
title.short: The Boy with the Sun in His Eyes

link.synopsis: Set at a Vietnam-era Ohio university, Jack Nicholson's directorial debut stars William Tepper as a basketball jock who finds plenty of distraction off the courts bedding a professor's wife (Karen Black) and getting drawn into the radical politics of the day. Capturing the chaos, zeal and lunacy of 1970s campus life, Nicholson's irreverent comedy co-stars frequent collaborator Henry Jaglom, Bruce Dern and David Ogden Stiers in a supporting role.
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family

link.synopsis: This smash-hit television series blends comedy and romance on the high seas, as Capt. Stubing (Gavin MacLeod), cruise director Julie (Lauren Tewes) and other crew members aboard the ship &NFi;Pacific Princess &NFi_;help their passengers find love that's exciting and new. Stuffed to steerage with celebrity guest stars season after season, this long-running show co-stars Ted Lange as Isaac, Bernie Koppel as Doc and Fred Gandy as loveable yeoman Gopher.
link.title: synopsis
One Day at a Time: Season 1
Saved by the Bell: The New Class
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium

link.synopsis: Pop star Britney Spears' younger sister, Jamie Lynn, stars in this Nickelodeon comedy as titular heroine Zoey Brooks, a teenage girl who attends the formerly all-boys Pacific Coast Academy as part of the school's first-ever mixed-gender class.
link.title: synopsis
The Suite Life on Deck: Anchors Away!
Wizards on Deck with Hannah Montana
Wizards of Waverly Place: Supernaturally Stylin'
The Suite Life of Zack & Cody: Lip Synchin' in the Rain
The Saddle Club: The First Adventure
That's So Raven: Disguise the Limit
Kim Possible Movie: So the Drama
Phil of the Future: Gadgets and Gizmos

link.synopsis: A spinoff of the hit BBC series "Little Britain," this sketch comedy show pulls no punches as it takes satirical aim at the idiosyncrasies of American culture through characters such as obese nudist Bubbles DeVere and precocious redhead Ellie-Grace.
link.title: synopsis
The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle
French & Saunders: Back with a Vengeance
South Park: A Very Buttery Collection
South Park: The Cult of Cartman
The Man Show Boy / Household Hints from Adult Film Stars
The Man Show Presents: Girls on Trampolines
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Saturday TV Funhouse

link.synopsis: Bollywood superstar Salman Khan plays Prem, an heir to a perfume fortune who falls in love with the wrong woman in this romantic comedy. After mistaking the woman for his appointed future wife, Prem must figure out how to fix the mess he's created.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in Mumbai

link.synopsis: Friz Freleng and David H. DePatie's supercool cat gets the royal treatment in this paw-some collection of 124 cartoon shorts, spawned by the slinky feline's star-making turn in the credits of Blake Edwards's comedy classic.
link.title: synopsis
Pink Panther Cartoon Collection: The Ant and the Aardvark
The Woody Woodpecker and Friends Classic Cartoon Collection: Vol. 2
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 6
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 2
Tom and Jerry: Spotlight Collection: Vol. 1
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 5
Tom and Jerry's Greatest Chases: Vol. 1
The Woody Woodpecker and Friends Classic Cartoon Collection
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 1
Hong Kong Phooey: The Complete Series
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 4
The Looney, Looney, Looney Bugs Bunny Movie
Felix the Cat: Golden Anniversary Edition
Tom and Jerry's Greatest Chases: Vol. 4
The Looney Tunes Golden Collection: Vol. 3
The Bugs Bunny Road Runner Movie
Kimba: The White Lion: Ultra Edition
VeggieTales: The Wonderful Wizard of Ha's
The Best of Mr. Peabody & Sherman
Clifford's Puppy Days: Practice Makes Perfect
Blue's Clues: Blue's Room: Alphabet Power
Blue's Clues: Get to Know Joe!
Blue's Clues: Blue's Room: Meet Blue's Baby Brother

title.regular: The Pink Panther Classic Cartoon Collection

link.synopsis: With an eye toward buying an expensive necklace for his ladylove (Jill Dixon), poor jewelry store clerk Norman Hackett (Norman Wisdom) decides to raise the funds by betting on a string of horse races. Surprisingly, Norman picks the winning ponies, but as his earnings accumulate, his bookie becomes reluctant to pay up. John Paddy Carstairs directs this screwball comedy that also stars Joan Sims and Marjorie Rhodes.
link.title: synopsis
The Return of the Pink Panther
The Knack...and How to Get It
The Ealing Comedy Collection: Whisky Galore

link.synopsis: Hang out at the intersection of technology and creativity with this eclectic collection of computer-animated short films, featuring the talents of an international team of writers and designers. The movies include the very funny "Jumpin' Jacques Splash," the artistically deft "Embryo" and the adorable "Tuber's Two Step." With romance, comedy and adventure to choose from, viewers of all ages are sure to find something that catches their fancy.
link.title: synopsis
Phantom Museums: The Short Films of the Quay Brothers
Congo: White King, Red Rubber, Black Death
Crime Inc: The True Story of the Mafia: Part 1
On the Mountain of Tai Hang

link.synopsis: It's a brand-new world of animation as this collection of fascinating short films -- which uses computer graphics technology in a way seldom seen -- proves beyond a shadow (make that pixel) of a doubt. Included are the award-winning and poignant This Wonderful Life; the hilarious comedy Chain Smoker; the metrical Traffic Jam; and the holiday-themed Ornaments. Children of all ages will enjoy this great compilation.
link.title: synopsis
Spike & Mike's Classic Festival of Animation
Art 21: Art in the Twenty-First Century
Tenchi the Movie 2: The Daughter of Darkness
Futurama the Movie: Bender's Big Score

link.synopsis: After her 16-year-old son disappears, a resourceful woman named Christine (Anny Duperey) enlists the aid of two of her former lovers by convincing each of them that he's the boy's father. It isn't long before the two men, François (Pierre Richard) and Jean (Gerard Depardieu), meet by chance, trade stories and decide to team up in their search -- forming one of the oddest and most inept partnerships France has ever seen.
link.title: synopsis
Jean de Florette / Manon of the Spring

link.synopsis: Alec Leamas (Richard Burton), a British Intelligence agent getting ready to retire, must undertake a final dangerous assignment before he can "come in from the cold," so he poses as a drunk in East Germany to gain information about other spies who've been captured. Leamas is soon thrown in jail, where he's grilled about his association with British agents. Claire Bloom co-stars in this riveting thriller adapted from John Le Carré's novel.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Art Direction Black and White nominee
category.term: Best Art Direction Black and White nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture

link.title: John Le Carre's A Perfect Spy

title.regular: The Spy Who Came In from the Cold
title.short: The Spy Who Came In from the Cold

link.synopsis: When his stepbrother steals the target of his schoolboy crush, seventh-grader Corey (Todd Fortune) embarks on a deadly quest to regain his self-esteem. It's bad enough that stepmom drinks and brother is a bona fide brute, but when Corey's attempts at wooing a classmate are dashed, his rage rises to the level of murder. Filmmaker Bill Morroni makes his directorial debut with this tale of a dysfunctional family, adolescent angst and bloodlust.
link.title: synopsis
The Secrets of Isis: Complete Series
Star of David: Hunting for Beautiful Girls
From a Whisper to a Scream
Children of the Corn IV: The Gathering
Children of the Corn 5: Fields of Terror
Children of the Corn 666: Isaac's Return
Stephen King's Children of the Corn
Children of the Corn 3: Urban Harvest
Stephen King's Children of the Corn

link.synopsis: When a hapless reporter (Bob Hope) uncovers a Nazi spy ring operating in the nation's capital, he enlists the help of his girlfriend (Dorothy Lamour) to help him crack the story. But the hilarious mayhem he unleashes is more than he bargained for. Together, can they break the story, win back their professional credibility and escape with their lives? Directed by David Butler, this classic comedy also features Otto Preminger and Philip Ahn.
link.title: synopsis
The Big Broadcast of 1938 / College Swing
Sorrowful Jones / The Paleface: Double Feature
Monsieur Beaucaire / Where There's Life: Double Feature
Thank You, Jeeves / Step Lively, Jeeves!
My Favorite Blonde / Star Spangled Rhythm
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
East Side of Heaven / If I Had My Way
By the Light of the Silvery Moon

link.synopsis: Homophobe Walt Koontz (Robert De Niro) suffers a debilitating stroke and must take therapeutic singing lessons for his paralyzed larynx. But his teacher happens to be his neighbor, Rusty Zimmerman (Philip Seymour Hoffman) -- a florid drag queen who despises bigoted straight people. Can the pair work through their prejudices and meet in the middle? Joel Schumacher directs this comedy-drama co-starring Daphne Rubin-Vega.
link.title: synopsis
Sex and the City: The Movie
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love
Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil

link.synopsis: Catch a wave and a psychotic seaside killer in this comedy-horror spoof on the popular beach party movies of the 1960s. Lauren Ambrose stars as Florence, a schizophrenic surfer chick, and her alter ego, Ann, a promiscuous partier with a violent streak and a mouth like a truck driver. When a rash of sun-drenched murders occurs, "both" women become prime suspects, along with a surfing guru, a B-movie actress and a Swedish exchange student.
link.title: synopsis
The Lady in Question Is Charles Busch
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It

link.synopsis: Slapstick abounds in this quartet of comedies starring icons Bud Abbott and Lou Costello. One Night in the Tropics, the duo's first film together, finds them helping a young couple menaced by criminals. Their most famous movie, Buck Privates, lands them in hot water on an army base, and In the Navy continues their military adventures as they again co-star with the Andrew Sisters. Hold That Ghost pits the boys against ghosts and gangsters.
link.title: synopsis
Keep 'Em Flying / Ride 'Em Cowboy / Pardon My Sarong / Who Done It?
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 3
Abbott & Costello: Lost in a Harem / Abbott & Costello in Hollywood
Jerry Garcia Band: Live at Shoreline
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 4
The Three Stooges: All the World's a Stooge
The Three Stooges: Healthy, Wealthy and Dumb
The Three Stooges: Three Smart Saps

title.regular: One Night in the Tropics / Buck Privates / In the Navy / Hold That Ghost

link.synopsis: "Politically Incorrect" creator and host Bill Maher gives his biting, satiric wit free rein in this HBO special in which he takes on such contemporary topics as the evils of big government and the confounding power that women have over men. Recorded in San Francisco in 2000, this program features Maher's trademark acerbic performance style, which definitely affirms why he continues to be on comedy's cutting edge.
link.title: synopsis
Bill Maher: Victory Begins at Home
Lewis Black: Red, White and Screwed
George Carlin: Life Is Worth Losing
George Carlin: You are All Diseased
Dennis Miller: The HBO Comedy Specials
Assume the Position with Mr. Wuhl
Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America: A Final Night with George W. Bush
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
George Carlin: It's Bad for Ya
Basic Black: The Lewis Black Story
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
The Zany Adventures of Robin Hood

link.synopsis: Silver-screen icon Jean Arthur, the quintessential comedic actress of the 1930s and '40s, headlines this pair of hilarious screwball comedies, starring alongside Fred MacMurray and Herbert Marshall. In the first film, Marshall and Arthur pose as husband and wife to secure a job as a married cook and butler duo. Next, Arthur finds herself in a tough spot when the husband she's long presumed dead turns up alive and discovers she's remarried.
link.title: synopsis
My Sister Eileen / She Wouldn't Say Yes
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
No Time for Love / The Egg and I
You Can't Take It with You
Deanna Durbin: Lady on a Train

title.regular: If You Could Only Cook / Too Many Husbands
title.short: If You Could Only Cook / Too Many Husbands

link.synopsis: Looking to hook up with a service buddy (Joe Namath) and to make it as a country music crooner, ex-Marine Norwood Pratt (Glen Campbell) heads to New York City. Along the way, he finds himself in the midst of adventures involving stolen cars, a dancing hen and an unwed mother (Kim Darby). Namath made his big-screen debut in this lightweight comedy also starring Pat Hingle as a flimflam man and Tisha Sterling as a jaded hippie.
link.title: synopsis
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series

link.synopsis: Walter Paisley (Dick Miller) is a shy busboy at a hip coffeehouse where beatnik poets perform. Yearning to be accepted into the world of avant-garde art, Paisley finally gets his chance when his sculpture of (and containing) a dead cat turns him into an overnight sensation. Barboura Morris, Ed Nelson and future game show host Bert Convy co-star in B-movie king Roger Corman's classic black comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Masque of the Red Death
It! The Terror from Beyond Space
The Gore Gore Girls: Special Edition
Creature from the Black Lagoon: Special Edition

link.synopsis: The director and star of 1931's Frankenstein reunite for this classic creepy-family black comedy. When stranded motorists arrive at a misty Welsh mansion, they find a family of fanatics, lunatics and a 102-year-old patriarch (played by a woman).
link.title: synopsis
Mr. Sardonicus / The Old Dark House
The Black Room / The Man They Couldn't Hang
Frankenstein / Bride of Frankenstein: The Legacy Collection
Val Lewton: I Walked with a Zombie / The Body Snatcher
Son of Frankenstein / Ghost of Frankenstein
The Masque of the Red Death / The Premature Burial
Night of the Demon / Curse of the Demon
The Wolf Man / Frankenstein Meets the Wolf Man
Val Lewton: The Leopard Man / The Ghost Ship
The Phantom Light / Red Ensign / The Upturned Glass
The Man Who Changed His Mind

link.synopsis: Steve Arlo (Ben Stiller) and Daryl Zero (Bill Pullman) have the art of private investigation covered from A to Z, even with their newest case: finding a shady tycoon's missing keys. But when love zeroes in on Zero, the world's best detective suddenly hasn't got a clue. Ryan O'Neal and Kim Dickens co-star in writer-director Jake Kasdan's feature-film debut, a clever comedy marked by a sleuth's eye for detail.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In Kevin Williamson's directorial debut, honor student Leigh Ann Watson (Katie Holmes) and her friends Luke (Barry Watson) and Jo Lynn (Marisa Coughlan) get tangled in the nasty Mrs. Tingle's (Helen Mirren) web. Things start innocently as Leigh Ann tries to keep her grades up, but a misunderstanding leads to blackmail and possibly worse for Mrs. Tingle. Coach "Spanky" Wenchell (Jeffrey Tambor) adds a lighter element to this dark teenage comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Roman Spring of Mrs. Stone
The Apple Cart / Caesar and Claretta

link.synopsis: Cartoonist Stu Miley (Brendan Fraser) finds success with his raucous creation, a troublemaking simian named Monkeybone. But after a car accident puts Miley in a coma, he finds himself face-to-face with Monkeybone in a freakish netherworld called Downtown. Blending live action with stop-motion animation, this imaginative comedy follows Miley as he fends off Monkeybone's mischievous mishaps and tries to find his way back to the real world.
link.title: synopsis
Spike and Mike's Sick & Twisted Festival of Animation: Full Frontal
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Shaolin vs. Evil Dead: Ultimate Power
Star Trek III: The Search for Spock

link.synopsis: In this sequel to the comedy hit based on a recurring "SNL" skit, a message from Jim Morrison in a dream prompts cable access TV stars Wayne (Mike Myers) and Garth (Dana Carvey) to put on a rock concert, "Waynestock," with Aerosmith as headliners. But amid the preparations, Wayne frets that a record producer is putting the moves on his girlfriend, Cassandra (Tia Carrere), while Garth handles the advances of mega-babe Honey Hornee (Kim Basinger).
link.title: synopsis
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
So I Married an Axe Murderer
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Mike Myers
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie
Empire Records: Remix! Special Fan Edition

link.synopsis: Candy (Charlize Theron) and Lonnie Earl (Billy Bob Thornton) are crazy about each other. But she's married to Roy (Patrick Swayze), and he's hitched to Darlene (Natasha Richardson). So far it's been a secret affair, but that's about to change when the quartet embarks on a cross-country road trip to a truck show in Reno. When the cat's let out of the bag, all heck breaks loose. Jordan Brady directs this irreverent comedy.
link.title: synopsis
I Think I Love My Wife
The Life & Death of Peter Sellers

link.synopsis: John Cusack stars as Dan, a plucky-but-unlucky prep school kid whose plans to join his girlfriend, Lori, on a Caribbean cruise go haywire when he misses the flight. To catch up, he'll have to foil pirates, drug runners and other shady islanders. And unfortunately for Dan, finding Lori doesn't put an end to all the high jinks. This entertaining comedy also features Robert Loggia, Jerry Stiller and Ben Stiller.
link.title: synopsis
Half a Loaf of Kung Fu
Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead
See No Evil, Hear No Evil

link.synopsis: In director Blake Edwards's satire of the Hollywood film industry, squeaky-clean superstar Sally Miles (Julie Andrews) is the key to a fading director's (Richard Mulligan) sudden plan to flip his flop into a smash: He wants Sally to appear topless in a reshot version of his film. This wickedly funny, ingeniously subversive comedy also stars Larry Hagman, William Holden, Robert Preston, Robert Vaughn, Loretta Swit and Rosanna Arquette.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: What Did You Do in the War, Daddy?
My Favorite Broadway: The Love Songs
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Monty Python's The Meaning of Life

link.synopsis: Patti (Christina Ricci) is a small-town teenager whose assertive tomcat, D.C., unravels a kidnapping plot like a ball of yarn -- much to the chagrin of the bungling kidnappers in this Disney family comedy based on the novel Undercover Cat. Ricci takes over the role originated by Hayley Mills in the 1965 version of the film, and Dean Jones, who starred in the original, returns in a different role in this remake.
link.title: synopsis
The Horse in the Gray Flannel Suit
Rudyard Kipling's The Second Jungle Book: Mowgli and Baloo
The Magic of the Golden Bear: Goldy III

link.synopsis: Michael J. Fox makes his film debut in this raucous teen comedy about college students of all stripes -- jocks, geeks and preppies -- who join in on a crazy, all-night scavenger hunt that has them running around campus toward the big finish.
link.title: synopsis
Girls Just Want to Have Fun
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise
Bring It On: All or Nothing

link.synopsis: Neil Simon's hit Broadway comedy makes a seamless transition to the big screen. Middle-aged New York City executive Mel has recently been "downsized" and doesn't know where to turn -- even though his sympathetic wife (Anne Bancroft) is just an arm's length away. The crazy ups and downs that follow keep the couple on their toes, if not on the edge of a nervous breakdown. Look fast for a young Sylvester Stallone as a man mistaken for a mugger.
link.title: synopsis
A Guide for the Married Man
To Be or Not To Be
How to Make an American Quilt
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different
The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes

link.synopsis: Host Mike Nelson continues the cultish comedy cavalcade of biting sarcastic humor that can only be "Mystery Science Theater 3000." This time out, the gang takes on a 1994 sci-fi disaster called Time Chasers. In the film, a man perfects time travel using a Commodore 64 and an airplane, but licenses the technology to an evil CEO, resulting in ridiculous scenes portraying the future and past. Nelson and his two robot buddies take dead aim at this bomb.
link.title: synopsis
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Overdrawn at the Memory Bank
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Prince of Space
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Brain That Wouldn't Die

link.synopsis: Joel, Crow and Tom Servo subject themselves to legendarily bad horror flick Manos: The Hands of Fate, all in the name of hilarious comedy. Manos is ostensibly about a family terrorized by a ranch hand and his flock of ghostly zombie women. But with dreadful production values and laughable acting, Manos is ripe for the "MST3K" treatment. Can the family avoid the fate of certain death that faces them, or will the "MST3K" crew skewer them first?

link.synopsis: Forty years after his extranged brother Francesco came out of the closet, disapproving Nicolo must confront his sibling amid the chaos of his mother's funeral and his daughter's wedding in this heartwarming comedy set in Southern Italy.
link.title: synopsis
The Mighty Saturns: Saturn I and IB
Fabulous! The Story of Queer Cinema
Adored: Diary of a Porn Star

link.synopsis: This 1970s comedy broke new ground in network television by featuring a Hispanic actor -- Freddie Prinze -- in the lead (a role that made him a star). The show follows the ups and downs of two men from wildly different backgrounds as they work together in an auto shop. Fusty Irishman Ed Brown (Jack Albertson) owns the garage, while his assistant, Chico (Prinze), lives with him in a backroom. This video features six episodes from the show.
link.title: synopsis
Tony Orlando & Dawn: The Ultimate Collection
One Day at a Time: Season 1
Not On Your Nellie: The Complete First Series

title.regular: Chico and the Man: TV Favorites
title.short: Chico and the Man: TV Favorites

link.synopsis: Businessman Daltry tackles the toughest job in his life when his estranged daughter comes to live with him in this dark comedy. With business in a downswing, the golf mogul struggles to keep the profits rolling in while trying to be a good father.
link.title: synopsis
Jackass Presents: Mat Hoffman's Tribute to Evel Knievel
National Lampoon Presents: The Beach Party at the Threshold of Hell
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself

link.synopsis: A New York DJ winds up protecting the gorgeous daughter of a Mafia kingpin in this edgy romantic comedy. After he saves the life of a mob boss (Chazz Palminteri), DJ Darrell (Usher Raymond) is rewarded with a job guarding the don's daughter, Dolly (Emmanuelle Chriqui). There's sexy chemistry between the beauty and the bodyguard, much to the dismay of Dolly's old-school Italian papa, who's also dealing with a dangerous criminal power-play.
link.title: synopsis
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family
Usher: Rhythm City: Vol. 1: Money, Power, Respect
Jamie Foxx: Straight from the Foxxhole
You Don't Mess with the Zohan

link.synopsis: Lena Horne, Bill "Bojangles" Robinson, Cab Calloway and Fats Waller star in this 1940s musical comedy that's light on plot line but brimming with sensational song and dance numbers by the top African-American performers of the day. Highlights include Horne's soulful "Stormy Weather," Robinson's lively stepping to "African Dance" and Waller's "Ain't Misbehavin'." Dooley Wilson, Ada Brown and the Nicholas Brothers round out the talented cast.
link.title: synopsis
Cab Calloway: Hi-De-Ho and Other Movies
Fats Waller: This Joint Is Jumpin'
Birth of the Blues / Blue Skies: Double Feature
There's No Business Like Show Business

link.synopsis: Hollywood's musical master Busby Berkeley choreographed this lavish comedy starring Joan Blondell, Ruby Keeler and Aline MacMahon as three showgirls looking for financial backing for a new production. A young songwriter (Dick Powell) offers to put up the cash, but when his blue-blooded family discovers what he's up to, they plot to ruin his plans. This hit film received a Best Sound Oscar nomination and was selected to the National Film Registry.
link.title: synopsis
Laurel & Hardy: March of the Wooden Soldiers
Rhythm on the Range / Rhythm on the River: Double Feature
I Am a Fugitive from a Chain Gang

link.synopsis: Writer-director Jeff Anderson (Clerks) stars in this comedy about a man whose fiancée dumps him on the eve of his bachelor party. As the troubled couple prepares to regroup and sort out their relationship, they both get some advice from their pals. She gets an earful about love from her angry best friend, while he gets dragged into his buddies' antics. Jeremy Sisto, Rashida Jones, Trevor Fehrman and Kevin Smith co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Sold Out: A Threevening with Kevin Smith
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: While riding the train, a desperate geek meets the girl of his dreams, prompting the socially deprived but brave young nerd to start a chat room thread asking his faceless Internet compatriots, "How do you talk to girls?" The courtship advice he receives from his online pals -- and what he does with their expert counsel -- form the basis for this charming romantic comedy, a love story for the 21st century.
link.title: synopsis
The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
The Romance of Astrea and Celadon

link.synopsis: The staff and clientele of a hip London coffeehouse find their lives, jobs and relationships blending together in this quirky ensemble comedy. Trouble starts brewing after manager Rachel (Marsha Thomason) fires and dumps her chef boyfriend, forcing the waitstaff (played in part by Breckin Meyer and Mena Suvari) to fill in. What ensues is a hectic and hilarious day in the life of the Black Cat Café in this debut feature by director John Cosgrove.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
Return to House on Haunted Hill
Sex and Lies in Sin City
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
The Night of the White Pants

link.synopsis: A group of partying ski instructors known as "Section Eight" finds time between chasing girls and chugging beer to take on a snobbish rival school's instructors in an annual contest. This year, there's more than just bragging rights on the line -- they're skiing for their jobs! Dean Cameron, Tom Bresnahan, Darlene Vogel and Patrick Labyorteaux star in director Damian Lee's rowdy comedy, filmed on location at British Columbia's Whistler Mountain.
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Boarding School Dropouts
See No Evil, Hear No Evil

link.synopsis: Two former high school buddies are reunited when Nate, a quiet academic, gets divorced, and ends up staying with Mitch, a record producer. Nate soon meets the perfect woman at one of Mitch's many parties, only to learn that she's a stripper. As Mitch tries to help his old pal sort out his suddenly complicated love life, Nate must reevaluate some of his ideas about women in this comedy starring Pedro Torres, Kam and Jasmine Simpkins.
link.title: synopsis
Black Woman's Guide to Getting Married
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
The Night of the White Pants
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: After a makeover by his girlfriend, Tiffany (Jazsmin Lewis), the average Byron (Jason Winston George) is transformed into a surprise reality TV star. He's thrilled to find he's also a hit with the ladies, and Tiffany enlists relationship expert Shanté Smith (Vivica A. Fox) for help holding on to her man. Meanwhile, Byron's pal Gizzard, happy to play wingman to the new star, urges him to enjoy the single life in this comedy sequel.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Man Is Hard to Find
I Think I Love My Wife
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Keepin' the Faith: Lookin' for Mr. Right
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man

link.synopsis: Filmmaker Lionel Baier writes, directs and stars in this quirky comedy about the hilarious misadventures of Swiss-born gay man named Lionel (Baier) whose life is turned upside down when he discovers he has Polish roots. Immediately immersing himself in all things Polish, Lionel loses himself in his journey of newfound self-discovery and risks losing everything else -- including his career, his boyfriend and his mind.
link.title: synopsis
In the Arms of My Enemy

link.synopsis: Thomas Miller (Forrest Landis) has a reputation for lying. So when he catches wind of a plot to kidnap the president's daughter, he tells anyone who will listen -- but nobody's willing to believe him, except his best friend, Jackie (AnnaSophia Robb). They may be just kids, but now it's up to Thomas and Jackie to keep the First Daughter out of danger. Lea Thompson and D.L. Hughley co-star in this kid-friendly comedy of presidential proportions.
link.title: synopsis
Spy Kids 2: The Island of Lost Dreams
Labou and the Quest for the Lost Treasure
The Secret of NIMH 2: Timmy to the Rescue

link.synopsis: Ever since a notorious incident drove him off the tennis court years ago, Gary (Seann William Scott) has been laboring as a raunchy high school janitor. But when the current coach drops dead, Gary steps in and is tasked with whipping the dork-tastic team into shape. As Gary leads the squad to the state tennis championship, his bizarre coaching methods draw the ire of teachers, parents and even his own team in this balls-out comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Boarding School Dropouts
Larry the Cable Guy: Health Inspector
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star

title.regular: Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
title.short: Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach

link.synopsis: Gurinder Chadha's delightfully irreverent comedy stars Shabana Azmi as Mrs. Sethi, a mother bent on finding her daughter a husband by any means, even if it kills her. Or, rather, even if it requires her to kill. She can't help herself: When her daughter's deemed not good enough, she defends as she thinks any good mother should. But how can she shake the cops' scrutiny? Suicide's not an option, at least not until she's able to marry off her child.
link.title: synopsis
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People

link.synopsis: After striking it rich with an idiotic invention, Qin Fen (You Ge) turns his ingenuity to online dating. Following a string of wild blind dates, he meets Smiley (Qi Shu), a gorgeous flight attendant who's way out of his league. But another chance encounter leads the duo on a surprise trip to beautiful Hokkaido, Japan, where an unlikely bond begins to blossom in this wildly popular romantic comedy from writer-director Xiaogang Feng.
link.title: synopsis
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage
Who's the Woman, Who's the Man

link.synopsis: When straitlaced recent divorce Alice Washington (Cybill Shepherd) returns to Smith College to complete the coursework she began years before, her plans for a dignified college career vanish when she meets her wild child roommate, Zoe (Corri English). With Zoe's help, Alice learns to loosen up, but she may go too far when she ponders a verboten relationship with her poetry professor (Jeffrey Nordling). Armand Mastroianni directs this engaging comedy.
link.title: synopsis
